page.title: 14INDUSTRY AROUND STAINLAND
page.content: {CLOCK FACE QUARRY } The quarry gets its name from the fields around which are shaped like a grandfather clock. It is situated at { {Withens End,}and is a stone quarry. To get the stone out of the ground they have to drill deep holes, then they put gelignite into the holes which blasts out the stone. A mechanical digger collects the stone, and takes it to the crusher where the stone is crushed into 24cm pieces, which is called aggregate. The pieces of stone are then taken by conveyor- belt to a big storage bin. Wagons come to collect the stone. They drive under the storage bin and the stone is loaded. There is an automatic weighing machine attached to the conveyor-belt which weighs the stone as it is dropped into the wagons.
